metadata.title: CVE-2017-18191 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in OpenStack Nova 15.x through 15.1.0 and 16.x through 16.1.1. By detaching and reattaching an encrypted volume, an attacker may access the underlying raw volume and corrupt the LUKS header, resulting in a denial of service attack on the compute host. (The same code error also results in data loss, but that is not a vulnerability because the user loses their own data.) All Nova setups supporting encrypted volumes are affected.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-18191` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

nova-ajax-console-proxy - 2:18.0.0~b1-0ubuntu1
nova-api - 2:18.0.0~b1-0ubuntu1
nova-api-metadata - 2:18.0.0~b1-0ubuntu1
nova-api-os-compute - 2:18.0.0~b1-0ubuntu1
nova-api-os-volume - 2:18.0.0~b1-0ubuntu1
nova-cells - 2:18.0.0~b1-0ubuntu1
nova-common - 2:18.0.0~b1-0ubuntu1
nova-compute - 2:18.0.0~b1-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-ironic - 2:18.0.0~b1-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-kvm - 2:18.0.0~b1-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-libvirt - 2:18.0.0~b1-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-lxc - 2:18.0.0~b1-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-qemu - 2:18.0.0~b1-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-vmware - 2:18.0.0~b1-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-xen - 2:18.0.0~b1-0ubuntu1
nova-conductor - 2:18.0.0~b1-0ubuntu1
nova-novncproxy - 2:18.0.0~b1-0ubuntu1
nova-scheduler - 2:18.0.0~b1-0ubuntu1
nova-serialproxy - 2:18.0.0~b1-0ubuntu1
nova-spiceproxy - 2:18.0.0~b1-0ubuntu1
nova-volume - 2:18.0.0~b1-0ubuntu1
python3-nova - 2:18.0.0~b1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nova package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:18.0.0~b1-0ubuntu1').
